content.description:
This route is on a moderate size boulder along with

Claw

and

Claw arête

. It's the easiest route on the boulder, with a lot of possibly chipped easy crimps to hold on to. The crux is the top out. There is no very easy way down.

Forgive me and my terrible route names.
content.location: The route is a bit down the trail from The Mo-Fo. It is near a huge, crumbly rock and is a little bit hidden. You can see the top from the trail, especially the claw-like part.

content.description:
This route is the rather mossy arête to the right of Claw. It is a fun, but hard climb with the enjoyment lowered because of the moss. If it gets cleaned, the difficulty may be lowered.

You must use the Arete for your hands until you can reach the top.
content.location: The route is a bit down the trail from The Mo-Fo. It is near a huge, crumbly rock and is a little bit hidden. You can see the top from the trail, especially the claw-like part.

content.description:
This route is the clean face on the right side of

Front'n Mossy

. Crouch start on two crimps. Dyno to reach the top. Then mantle.

The aretes to either side are off.
content.location: The route is a bit down the trail from The Mo-Fo. It is near a huge, crumbly rock and is a little bit hidden. You can see the top from the trail, especially the claw-like part.

content.description: Climb up the slab to the left of Angry Bear Slab. The jugs to the right are off.

Start on tiny crimps and move up to a jug. The arete is off.

Angry Bear Slab is the slabby face to the right of Claw Arete. It has a pretty hard starting move but the rest of the problem is easy. It is very clean and moss-free for the first half, but it is pretty dirty the second half. This problem took me a while to complete, but after I found a tiny foothold for the starting move, I was able to complete it a little bit easier.

The arete to the left of this problem is off.
content.location: This problem is on the same boulder as Front'n mossy, Claw, and Claw Arete. It is the slabby face to the right of Claw Arete.
